thread.title: Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home
thread.title_full: Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home

author: DOUG FERGUSON
title: Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home
text:
Lee Jin-man Presidents Cup Capsules 
International team player Danny Lee, left, of New Zealand celebrates after playing partner Sangmoon Bae of South Korea sank a putt on the 18th green to win their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Woohae Cho Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Danny Lee of New Zealand walks with playing partner Sangmoon Bae of South Korea during their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Woohae Cho) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Sangmoon Bae of South Korea hits a tee shot on the fourth hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
United States' Zach Johnson, left, watches his tee shot on the fifth hole as teammate Phil Mickelson looks on during their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Louis Oosthuizen of South Africa watches his tee shot on the second hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Ahn Young-joon Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
International team player Charl Schwartzel of South Africa reacts after sinking a putt on the 13th hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Ahn Young-joon Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home 
International team player Thongchai Jaidee, right, of Thailand walks with playing partner International team player Charl Schwartzel of South Africa during their four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Ahn Young-joon) Lee Jin-man Bae leads an International team rally amid Mickelson mistake 
United States' Jordan Spieth plays out of the rough on the second hole during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Woohae Cho Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home 
International team player Adam Scott, left, of Australia celebrates with teammate's Sangmoon Bae, right, of South Korea and Danny Lee, centre, of New Zealand after winning their four ball matches at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Woohae Cho) Lee Jin-man Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home 
United States' Jimmy Walker reacts after missing a putt on the 18th green during his four ball match at the Presidents Cup golf tournament at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea, in Incheon, South Korea, Friday, Oct. 9, 2015.(AP Photo/Lee Jin-man) Bae delivers big moment in Presidents Cup debut at home Associated Press | 
INCHEON, South Korea (AP) — Bae Sang-moon never felt the kind of pressure that weighed on him Friday at the Presidents Cup. 
He only made news in South Korea this year during a failed bid to extend his waiver for mandatory military service. He wasn't sure what kind of reception he would receive at the Jack Nicklaus Golf Club Korea. And as Bae stood over a 12-foot putt that was critical to the International team's rally, half his teammates were on the edge of the green and thousands of Koreans were watching in the gallery.
